linkTarget.anchoringText: North East Abu Gharadig-1 field is located in the onshore of northern part of the western desert in Egypt. About 180 km west Cairo city, Bahariya formation of Cenomanian Cretaceous age is the main reservoir in NEAG_1 field that is 90% of the Western Desert fields are producing from with several effective and possibly laterally Continuous seal (EGPC 1992), in this field Bahariya sandstones is found at shallow depth+ 1200 m.ss and consists of a sequence of thin bedded sandstone, shales and siltstone with vertical and lateral heterogeneity. Neag-1 development lease is a part of North east Abu Gharadig concession (Neag extension). Located in northern part of the western dessert in Egypt (Fig. 1) at the southeastern end of the inverted Mubarak Ridge. The Badr El Din Petroleum Company (Bapetco) operates this concession on behalf of the NEAG stakeholders.

A Complex three way dip fault closure at top Bahariya level, two separate accumulations lie at the intersection between an inverted northeast trending reverse fault (to the West) and trapped with northwest trending normal faults. Both structures are similar in structural style and separated by normal faults of± 200 m throw (Fig. 2). The reverse bounding fault was resulted from compressional tectonic forces of the late Cretaceous age known as Syrian arc deformation of northeast-southwest trending folds (Moustafa et al. 1998). The northwest trending normal fault is broken into three normal en-echelon faults, with the main structural closure along the central of these three faults. These faults may result in fault block compartmentalization while smaller scale faults (below seismic resolution) may also create additional fault block compartmentalization resulted in poor connectivity on thin sands.

The reservoir section of the field under study is subdivided by definition of the lateral extended geo-markers (flooding shale or paleosoles) into five units in addition to episodes of glauconite pellets formation and subordinate carbonate precipitation, obvious variation in Bahariya reservoir properties and geometries and lake of unique pressure regime even at same unit propose multi stories of stacked channels. Bahariya Formation showed complex marginal marine setting mixing between tidal influences and estuarine-marginal marine that Characterized by a relatively low energy. (Fig. 3)

linkTarget.anchoringText: Attribute semblance was not considered at 3D modeling before as minor faults and fractures below the seismic resolution was not included in the reservoir modeling. A detailed interpretation of additional seismic markers was completed and followed by extraction of the semblance volume along the interpolated interpretation to detect discontinuities and see if there is a relation between these discontinuities and the current situation of Producers/Injectors connectivity in the field. This interpretation confirmed existence of additional barriers (minor faults) that inhibits good sweeping from producer to injector (Fig. 5) and allow for compartmentalization investigation, which will affect the well position and recovery due to the thin-bedded nature of the reservoir and result in offset individual sandstone layers.

image-wrap.label: Figure 5
image-wrap.caption: Faults and Fractures interpreted from Semblance and BHI.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Faults and Fractures interpreted from Semblance and BHI.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The applied pragmatic method was proposing to minimize the zones resolution in-order to fit for correlateability using the dense well control in open hole logs, pressure and performance to generate multiple sand maps as co-kriging in-put for facies modeling purpose (Fig. 6). The results will be constrained by three factors;

Data analysis was used for quality controlling the match between Input and output data probability used for facies and property modeling during the modeling processes. Facies proportion and attribute probability used for data transformation and modeling of properties as the histogram and function windows used to inspect the property distributions and the correlation between porosity and Permeability cases (Fig. 7).

linkTarget.anchoringText: Facies and Property models Histograms was checked for all realizations in-order to check the upscaling, model outputs compared to the raw data (Fig. 8). The first observation to all previous well log data of 23 well in such a block reflecting such ideal normal property distribution of tighter data range therefore, later after 7 infill wells the updates showed further heterogeneity in histograms in dense well data. In addition to the increasing of zones number leads to better identification for reservoir-non reservoir in uncontrolled spots between wells; hence the model is ready for simulation testing summery in table 3.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The results of present work for the Bahariya reservoir get a good match for 90% of cum. oil production, 98% match of cum. water Injection and 95 % of gross production as per attached Fig. 11 and 12, the ultimate recovery factor for this block is 25 %, which somehow less than other blocks that propose the new infill wells to sweep the discovered sweet spot close to the fold axis.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The interpreted faults working as barriers for flooding efficiency that prevent the flooding and pressure support from water injectors; it is required to manage each isolated block or segment separately in-order to accurately estimate the recovery and optimize flooding efficiency Fig. 16. It is a quite clear that there is hierarchy for provided recovery ranges in each block in addition to the effect of minor fractures associated in bended blocks 6 and 12 (Fig. 17). The infill activity are mainly based on shortage to achieve proper level of recovery at NFA activities.
